result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Elijah Quron Davis

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Elijah Quron Davis not in court, in custody.  Attorney Alexander J. Kostal appeared by video for Elijah Quron Davis.  Prosecuting attorney Claire E Zyber in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Kostal was just appointed to the case and is requesting a status conference.  Case is adjourned to 11-11-22 at 1:30 pm for status conference by zoom.
This hearing may be streamed live on DAcast at the discretion of the Court:
https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d84cd54a-763c-3a58-15a9-b84acf306616
Status conference scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Elijah Quron Davis not in court, in custody.  Attorney Thomas Holland Reed appeared by video for Elijah Quron Davis.  Prosecuting attorney Jacob A. Maule in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Reed informs the Court that Attorney Kostell is now the attorney of record.  Case is adjourned to 10-11-22 at 1:30 pm for status conference.
Status conference scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Thomas R. Reed in court, defendant Elijah Quron Davis not in court, in custody.  Michelle A. Grasso appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in Court for Order to Show Cause Hearing. Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast. Defendant not produced. Attorney Thomas Reed appeared on behalf of the State Public Defender's Office. Attorney Reed provides an update to the Court and requests additional time to appoint counsel. Court grants request. Preliminary hearing adjourned for cause. Case adjourned for Status of Counsel to Branch 10. This hearing may be streamed live on DAcast at the discretion of the Court: https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d84cd54a-763c-3a58-15a9-b84acf306616  Status conference scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed. OSPD APPOINTMENT OF COUNSEL REPORT

Defendant Elijah Quron Davis not in court, defendant in custody.  Michelle A. Grasso appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a hearing as to why an attorney has not been appointed yet.  Court is in a jury trial with another case.  Case is adjourned to 8-16-+22 at 1:30 pm for an Order to Show Cause hearing as to why an attorney has not been appointed.  Clerk notified State Public Defender's Office via email.  Order to show cause hearing scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Elijah Quron Davis not in court, defendant in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for cause to the trial court for a State V. Lee Hearing.  Hearing scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Elijah Quron Davis not in court, defendant in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for preliminary hearing. States witness is present. OPD needs additional time to appoint an attorney. State requests the matter be set for a State V. Lee hearing or status; denied. Court finds good CAUSE to adjourn preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Elijah Quron Davis not in court, defendant in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is not present. SPD has not appointed counsel. State requests this matter be set for a State V. Lee hearing in the trial court. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered no contact with CRN (5.19.2001)
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring; no contact order.  If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, Defendant to be released and placed on the waiting list.

Defendant Elijah Quron Davis in court with attorney Colleen Cullen.  Defendant Elijah Quron Davis in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Elijah Quron Davis appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 10.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor counts 2, 3 and 4.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Case is adjourned to Br. PE for Br. 10.  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
